intro: Meliosma nubicola, commonly known as the African mountain meliosma, is a small evergreen shrub native to the highlands of eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many economically important plants such as coffee and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its dense, leathery leaves that are typically dark green and glossy. It produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often blooming in late spring or early summer. Meliosma nubicola is adapted to cool, moist environments and is often found in forested areas at elevations above 1,500 meters.
